original: 8.25. Saññojanavippayuttasaññojaniyaduka🔽Saññojanavippayuttaṁ nasaññojaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto nasaññojaniyo🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Saññojanavippayuttaṁ nasaññojaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽saññojanavippayutto naasaññojaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Saññojanavippayuttaṁ
analyzed: saññojana vippayuttam na saññojaniyam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ na saññojaniyaḥ  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saññojana vippayuttam na saññojaniyam dhammam paṭicca  saññojana vippayuttaḥ na asaññojaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saññojana vippayutta
translated: The Dyad on Unconnected with Fetters, not Subject to Arising as Fetters🔽With an unwholesome citta that is connected with fetters, and with a wholesome citta that is connected with fetters, there arises a wholesome thought-arisal that is connected with fetters.

original: nasaññojaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto nasaññojaniyo ca saññojanavippayutto🔽naasaññojaniyo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: na saññojaniyam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ na saññojaniyaḥ ca saññojana vippayuttaḥ  na asaññojaniyaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome citta that is connected with fetters, and with a unwholesome citta that is connected with fetters, there arises a unwholesome thought-arisal that is connected with fetters.🔽With a wholesome citta that is connected with fetters, and with a unwholesome citta that is connected with fetters, there arises a wholesome thought-arisal that is connected with fetters.

original: Saññojanavippayuttaṁ naasaññojaniyaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto naasaññojaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: saññojana vippayuttam na asaññojaniyam dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ na asaññojaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a unwholesome citta that is connected with fetters, and with a wholesome citta that is connected with fetters, there arises a unwholesome thought-arisal that is connected with fetters.

original: Saññojanavippayuttaṁ nasaññojaniyañca saññojanavippayuttaṁ naasaññojaniyañca dhammaṁ paṭicca saññojanavippayutto naasaññojaniyo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: saññojana vippayuttam na saññojaniyam ca saññojana vippayuttam na asaññojaniyam ca dhammam paṭicca saññojana vippayuttaḥ na asaññojaniyaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta
translated: Dependent on a state that is dissociated from the fetters and not subject to cankers, a state that is dissociated from the fetters and not subject to cankers arises conditioned by root cause. … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca sabbattha vitthāro
translated: In the section on root cause there are five. In the section on object there are two. … In the section on non-hindrance there are five. (In all sections the method is the same as in the case of the aggregates.)
The section on the fetters is finished.
